Batch update to change subject links.

did.abstract: The Winther, O.O. mss., 1963-1967, consist of the letters and book reviews of Oscar Osburn Winther, 1903-1970, historian, of Indiana University.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Oscar Osburn Winther, 1903-1970, was a professor of history at Indiana University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Winther, O.O. mss., 1963-1967, are the letters and book reviews of Oscar Osburn Winther, 1903-1970, historian, of Indiana University. The letters are concerned with the book reviews which Winther wrote for several historical societies. The correspondents are Donald Floyd Danker, Wesley Southmayd Griswold, and Oscar Osburn Winther. The reviews are of books by John Haskell Kemble, Richard Cleghorn Overton, and Henry Pickering Walker.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Winther, O.O. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
